items.title: From OSINT to Internal Hunting
items.excerpt: How shifting from external OSINT to internal telemetry hunting changed the way I approach threat research — and where most of my published work actually comes from.

items.title: Automating Inquiry Triage with AI
items.excerpt: How I built a 9-phase AI pipeline to handle threat intelligence inquiries that used to take a week — and what it taught me about building tools from real pain points.

items.title: What Ransomware Hunting Actually Looks Like
items.excerpt: The daily reality of proactive ransomware hunting — from YARA triggers and VirusTotal dashboards to naming new families and building attack chains from telemetry.

items.title: MCP Servers for Threat Intelligence
items.excerpt: How I set up Model Context Protocol servers to bridge AI assistants with threat intelligence platforms — and what I learned about tool design along the way.

items.title: Infrastructure Hunting Beyond IOCs
items.excerpt: Moving up the Pyramid of Pain — from hash-based detection to hunting adversary infrastructure through behavioral fingerprints and network patterns.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware Deploys Linux Variant on Windows Systems Through Remote Management Tools and BYOVD Techniques
items.excerpt: Discovered Agenda ransomware deploying Linux variants on Windows systems via remote management tools and BYOVD techniques for cross-platform evasion.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware Group Adds SmokeLoader and NETXLOADER to Their Arsenal
items.excerpt: Uncovered Agenda ransomware group adopting SmokeLoader and a new loader named NETXLOADER for improved delivery and evasion.

items.title: Cerber Ransomware Exploits Atlassian Confluence Vulnerability CVE-2023-22518
items.excerpt: Documented Cerber ransomware operators rapidly weaponizing CVE-2023-22518 in Atlassian Confluence for initial access and encryption deployment.

items.title: New Ransomware Charon Uses Earth Baxia APT Techniques to Target Enterprises
items.excerpt: Discovered Charon ransomware using APT-grade techniques — DLL sideloading via Edge.exe, hybrid Curve25519/ChaCha20 encryption.

items.title: CrazyHunter Campaign Targets Taiwanese Critical Sectors
items.excerpt: Identified CrazyHunter targeting Taiwanese healthcare and education using 80% open-source tooling and BYOVD attacks.

items.title: Crypto24 Ransomware Group Blends Legitimate Tools with Custom Malware for Stealth Attacks
items.excerpt: Analyzed Crypto24 ransomware group's technique of blending legitimate tools with custom malware to bypass EDR and security technologies.

items.title: Silent Threat: Red Team Tool EDRSilencer Disrupting Endpoint Security Solutions
items.excerpt: First to document EDRSilencer weaponized in the wild — a red team tool using Windows Filtering Platform to blind EDR solutions.

items.title: AI-Assisted Fake GitHub Repositories Fuel SmartLoader and LummaStealer Distribution
items.excerpt: Uncovered AI-generated fake GitHub repositories distributing SmartLoader and LummaStealer through convincing but malicious code projects.

items.title: Unmasking The Gentlemen Ransomware: Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures Revealed
items.excerpt: Analysis of a new ransomware group with adaptive defense evasion — custom-patching anti-AV tools mid-attack based on target recon.

items.title: New LockBit 5.0 Targets Windows, Linux, ESXi
items.excerpt: Technical analysis of LockBit 5.0 — cross-platform ransomware with heavy obfuscation, anti-analysis, and geopolitical safeguards.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware Adopts TrueSightKiller for EDR Evasion
items.excerpt: Thread detailing how the Agenda ransomware group incorporated the open-source TrueSightKiller tool to disable antivirus and EDR systems via BYOVD techniques.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware Variant Uses Obfuscated .NET Loader with Reflective Loading
items.excerpt: Thread on an Agenda ransomware variant leveraging a highly obfuscated .NET loader using Reflective Loading and .NET Reactor for defense evasion.

items.title: MedusaLocker's Sophisticated Three-Pronged Attack Strategy
items.excerpt: Thread detailing a sophisticated new three-pronged attack strategy employed by MedusaLocker ransomware threat actors identified by the Threat Hunting team.

items.title: Morpheus Ransomware Emerges with New Data-Leak Site
items.excerpt: Thread on the emergence of the Morpheus ransomware group and its new data-leak site, with early victims including an Australian pharmaceutical firm and a German electronics company.

items.title: Nitrogen Ransomware: Fake Updates and Malicious Browser Extensions
items.excerpt: Thread on the rapidly evolving Nitrogen ransomware group using social engineering via fake updates and malicious browser extensions for initial access.

items.title: Play Ransomware's First Linux Variant Targets ESXi
items.excerpt: Thread announcing the discovery of a new Linux variant of Play ransomware targeting ESXi environments, marking an expansion in the group's range and impact.

items.title: SmokeLoader Delivers W3CryptoLocker via Steganography
items.excerpt: Thread analyzing SmokeLoader's use of steganography techniques to deliver W3CryptoLocker ransomware payloads while evading detection mechanisms.

items.title: Chaos Ransomware Leverages Advanced Anti-EDR Techniques
items.excerpt: Thread analyzing the Chaos ransomware campaign leveraging malicious DLL sideloading and kernel-level driver deployment for broad defense evasion against EDR solutions.

items.title: CVE-2025-53770 & CVE-2025-53771: SharePoint Zero-Days at Pwn2Own
items.excerpt: Thread on CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771 — vulnerabilities in on-premise Microsoft SharePoint servers discovered at Pwn2Own Berlin, with TippingPoint customers protected since May.

items.title: Charon Ransomware: Advanced Breach and Lateral Movement
items.excerpt: Thread exposing the newly identified Charon ransomware and its advanced methods for breaching and spreading within organizations.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware Exploits MeshAgent and WSL for Cross-Platform Attacks
items.excerpt: Thread on Agenda ransomware exploiting MeshAgent and Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) to deploy Linux payloads on Windows systems, raising the bar for cross-platform sophistication.

items.title: Five New Rust-Based Ransomware Families Identified
items.excerpt: Thread analyzing five distinct ransomware groups written in Rust identified in early December 2025, signaling an accelerated shift in how threat actors build and scale attacks.

items.title: Agenda Ransomware: Continued Linux-on-Windows Campaign
items.excerpt: Thread on a new Agenda ransomware campaign continuing the group's use of Linux binaries on Windows systems, with new techniques and tooling building on earlier 2025 attacks.

items.title: Werewolves: Investigating a New Ransomware Player
items.excerpt: Thread investigating the newly identified Werewolves ransomware group after an external researcher's blog post caught the Threat Hunting team's attention.

items.title: Play Ransomware Group's New Linux Variant Targets ESXi, Shows Ties With Prolific Puma
items.excerpt: First discovery of Play ransomware's Linux variant targeting ESXi, with infrastructure ties to Prolific Puma link-shortening service.

items.title: PureRAT Campaign Targets Job Seekers, Abuses Foxit PDF Reader for DLL Side-loading
items.excerpt: Uncovered PureRAT targeting job seekers using renamed Foxit PDF Reader for DLL side-loading and Python-based shellcode loaders.

items.title: Multistage RA World Ransomware Uses Anti-AV Tactics, Exploits GPO
items.excerpt: Analyzed RA World using GPO-distributed payloads, Safe Mode abuse for defense evasion, and Babuk-derived encryption.

items.title: Proactive Security for CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771 SharePoint Attacks
items.excerpt: Provided proactive security analysis of CVE-2025-53770 and CVE-2025-53771 — SharePoint vulnerabilities enabling unauthenticated remote code execution.

items.title: Revisiting UNC3886 Tactics to Defend Against Present Risk
items.excerpt: Revisiting the tactics of UNC3886, a China-nexus threat actor targeting network edge devices and virtualization infrastructure.

items.title: Warlock: From SharePoint Vulnerability Exploit to Enterprise Ransomware
items.excerpt: Traced the Warlock ransomware campaign from initial SharePoint vulnerability exploit through lateral movement to enterprise-wide encryption.

items.title: Self-Propagating Malware Spreading Via WhatsApp, Targets Brazilian Users
items.excerpt: Identified an active campaign spreading self-propagating malware via WhatsApp ZIP attachments, targeting Brazilian users with persistence and account hijacking.

items.title: Security Automation Suite
items.excerpt: Collection of 13+ purpose-built tools covering RAG-powered report generation, malware-as-a-service analysis, PowerPoint threat brief analysis, AI chatbot for threat queries, BEC investigation workflows, and security log analysis — each automating a recurring analyst task.

items.title: Infrastructure Hunting Toolkit
items.excerpt: Methodology and tooling for adversary infrastructure identification using Shodan, Censys, FOFA, and passive DNS. Maps C2 servers through SSH key pivoting, SSL certificate analysis, HTTP header fingerprinting, ASN attribution, and cloud provider mapping — turning network artifacts into threat actor attribution and campaign tracking.

items.title: CTI Platform Connector
items.excerpt: Model Context Protocol server that connects AI assistants directly to a production threat intelligence platform, enabling natural language queries against indicators, campaigns, relationships, and labels — bridging the gap between AI tooling and operational threat data.

items.title: Threat Intelligence Platform
items.excerpt: Full-featured platform that curates cybersecurity RSS feeds, news, and articles into actionable intelligence. Generates concise reports from single or multiple sources, extracts IOCs, verifies detection coverage, produces CTI-ready JSON output with hunting queries, and auto-publishes to the team wiki — all in one workflow.

items.title: Threat Inquiry Pipeline
items.excerpt: 9-phase AI pipeline that automates the full threat inquiry lifecycle: understanding email context, researching across internal and external sources, enriching IOCs, verifying detection coverage, drafting analyst responses, generating visual assets, and publishing documentation — all autonomously within minutes.
